messages.content: ComfyUI-LaVi-Bridge-Wrapper is a wrapper node for ComfyUI that allows testing LaVi-Bridge using Diffusers.

You can install ComfyUI-LaVi-Bridge-Wrapper either by using the Manager's 'install from git' feature or by cloning the repo to custom_nodes and running 'pip install -r requirements.txt'. If using portable, run the command in the ComfyUI_windows_portable folder.
What files are automatically downloaded when installing ComfyUI-LaVi-Bridge-Wrapper?

When installing ComfyUI-LaVi-Bridge-Wrapper, the following files are automatically downloaded: https://huggingface.co/Kijai/t5-large-encoder-only-bf16/ to 'ComfyUI/models/t5_model/' and https://huggingface.co/shihaozhao/LaVi-Bridge/ to 'ComfyUI/models/lavibridge'.
Is the llama2 version of ComfyUI-LaVi-Bridge-Wrapper included?

Yes, the llama2 version of ComfyUI-LaVi-Bridge-Wrapper is included as a separate node. However, the author mentions that they couldn't get anything useful out of it and are unsure if it's due to a mistake or if it's not as good as expected.
What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-LaVi-Bridge-Wrapper node?
The purpose of the ComfyUI-LaVi-Bridge-Wrapper node is to test LaVi-Bridge using Diffusers within the ComfyUI environment.
Where should I run the installation command if I am using the portable version of ComfyUI?
If you are using the portable version of ComfyUI, you should run the installation command in the ComfyUI_windows_portable folder.
Can I install ComfyUI-LaVi-Bridge-Wrapper using the Manager's 'install from git' feature?
Yes, you can install ComfyUI-LaVi-Bridge-Wrapper using the Manager's 'install from git' feature.
